events.title: Birth of John F. Kennedy
events.description: John Fitzgerald Kennedy born in Brookline, Massachusetts, the second of nine children in the prominent Kennedy family.

events.title: Enters Harvard University
events.description: Kennedy begins his studies at Harvard University, following in his older brother Joe's footsteps.

events.title: Graduates from Harvard
events.description: Kennedy graduates cum laude from Harvard University with a Bachelor of Arts in government.

events.title: Joins U.S. Naval Reserve
events.description: Kennedy joins the U.S. Naval Reserve as World War II intensifies.

events.title: PT-109 Incident
events.description: Kennedy's PT boat is rammed and sunk by a Japanese destroyer. He saves his crew, earning the Navy and Marine Corps Medal for heroism.

events.title: Health Issues and Discharge
events.description: Kennedy suffers from chronic back pain and other health problems. Honorably discharged from active duty in early 1945.

events.title: Elected to U.S. House
events.description: Kennedy elected to represent Massachusetts' 11th congressional district at age 29.

events.title: Elected to U.S. Senate
events.description: Kennedy defeats incumbent Republican Henry Cabot Lodge Jr. to become U.S. Senator from Massachusetts.

events.title: Marries Jacqueline Bouvier
events.description: John F. Kennedy marries Jacqueline Lee Bouvier in Newport, Rhode Island.

events.title: Daughter Caroline Born
events.description: Caroline Bouvier Kennedy, the first child of John and Jacqueline Kennedy, is born.

events.title: Announces Presidential Campaign
events.description: Kennedy announces his candidacy for President of the United States.

events.title: First Presidential Debate
events.description: Kennedy and Nixon participate in the first televised presidential debate, watched by 70 million viewers.

events.title: Elected President
events.description: Kennedy defeats Richard Nixon in one of the closest presidential elections in American history.

events.title: Son John Jr. Born
events.description: John Fitzgerald Kennedy Jr. born, just weeks after his father's election.

events.title: Inaugurated as President
events.description: Kennedy delivers his famous inaugural address: 'Ask not what your country can do for you...'

events.title: Kennedy Presidency
events.description: John F. Kennedy serves as the 35th President of the United States.

events.title: Bay of Pigs Invasion
events.description: CIA-sponsored invasion of Cuba fails disastrously, becoming a major embarrassment for the new administration.

events.title: Cuban Missile Crisis
events.description: Thirteen-day confrontation between the United States and Soviet Union over nuclear missiles in Cuba.

events.title: "Ich bin ein Berliner" Speech
events.description: Kennedy delivers his famous speech in West Berlin, expressing solidarity with the people of Berlin.

events.title: March on Washington
events.description: Kennedy supports the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom where Dr. King delivers 'I Have a Dream' speech.

events.title: Assassination
events.description: President Kennedy is assassinated while riding in a motorcade through Dealey Plaza in Dallas, Texas.
